description:
The protagonist, Yaiba (Kurogane Yaiba), is a wild samurai boy who trains in the jungle with his father, Kenjuro! By chance, Yaiba returns to Japan, where he meets his rival Takeshi Onimaru, who has the same samurai spirit as Yaiba, in a new training ground.

Yaiba is living a life of serious competition, but when Onimaru obtains the “Legendary Demon Sword”, he is on a journey full of spectacle and great adventure...!

(Source: Crunchyroll News)

node.description:
__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.

__Favorite Food:__ Rice with curry

Gosho Aoyama, alternatively known by his real name Yoshimasa Aoyama, is a Japanese mangaka and animator, best known as the creator of Detective Conan (internationally known as Case Closed), Magic Kaito, and YAIBA.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1014039670085201920)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/135960980) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=yoshimichi_kameda)

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1189754972) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/bushi2424.bsky.social) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2415493) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takeshi_maenami)

He has gathered a lot of attention with his incredibly dynamic, [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-inspired cuts in [Pokémon Sun & Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/97634/). His animation is characterized by erratic snappy timing, liberal and ample use of smears (often with a complete lack of outlines), and extreme perspectives. 

Graduated Yoyogi Animation School in 2009, but spent much of the following years helping out at his parents' restaurant and didn't start formally working as an animator until 2018. Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1189754972) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/bushi2424.bsky.social) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/2415493) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=takeshi_maenami)

He has gathered a lot of attention with his incredibly dynamic, [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/)-inspired cuts in [Pokémon Sun & Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/97634/). His animation is characterized by erratic snappy timing, liberal and ample use of smears (often with a complete lack of outlines), and extreme perspectives. 

Graduated Yoyogi Animation School in 2009, but spent much of the following years helping out at his parents' restaurant and didn't start formally working as an animator until 2018. Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)
A Japanese arranger, composer, and member of the band [Jyukai](https://anilist.co/staff/100234/Jyukai).

[Website](https://www.yutakayamada.com/)

Yutaka Yamada is a Los Angeles-based music composer known for his work on the anime television series "Tokyo Ghoul", "VINLAND SAGA" and major Japanese films such as "Death Note:Light Up the New World", "BLEACH" and "KINDGOM". His masterpiece soundtracks for "Tokyo Ghoul" have gained worldwide popularity with related videos totaling over 70 million views on Youtube.

In 2018, Yamada composed for "Cry Me a Sad River", a Chinese film which had succeeded with USD $51Mil. In the same year, Eminem sampled Yamada's master piece "Glassy Sky (from "Tokyo Ghoul")" on his song "Good Guy" in his "Kamikaze" album. 
In 2019, he has worked alongside Sony Pictures for their mega-hit live-action film "KINGDOM" in which he received nomination for the 43rd Japan Academy Film Prize for Best Music Score. WIT Studio, famous for producing "Attack on Titan", released their most anticipated animation series "VINLAND SAGA", with an original soundtrack composed entirely by Yamada. 

Born in 1989, Yamada graduated from Senzoku Gakuen College of Music where he passionately studied musical composition. In 2009, he entered and won the first prize at VIENNA INSTRUMENTS Strings Arrangement Contest.

Today, he is represented by Soundtrack Music Associates, and has since relocated his production base from Tokyo to Sonic Fuel Studios in Los Angeles.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mathimekomachi) 

Animation Producer at [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Yoshimichi Kameda](https://anilist.co/staff/105635)
Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/editzhirose)** | **[Website](http://www.editz.jp/)**

**Hirose Kiyoshi** is a Japanese editor and film editor.

[Twitter](https://x.com/PJciDsLcfywX1BI?s=20)

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Website](https://sites.google.com/view/nakamurayukinori) | [Twitter](https://x.com/shockerNY)

Freelance CG artist and animator.

__Eiko Morikawa__ is a Japanese sound effects editor. She started working at Swara Production, then went to Rakuonsha, and now is the representative director of Chura Sound.

(Source: AniDB)

[Twitter](https://x.com/DkruaPUOPy88675)

Originating from [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/). Noted for his standout effects animation.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

name.native: ブルー・エンカウント

node.description:
__[Website](https://blueencount.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/BLUEN_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/blueencount_official/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/blueencountSMEJ)__

__Formed:__ 2004
__Genres:__ Rock (Mixture Rock, Indie Rock), Emo

__Introduction:__
Blue Encount (stylized as BLUE ENCOUNT), alternatively known under the abbreviation BLUEN is a Japanese four-piece rock band under record label Ki/oon Records (2014-), who have previously been under record label 美音 (Mio) (2013-2014)

__Biography:__
In 2003, Shunichi, Yuuya and Yoshihide met at a vocational school in the Kumamoto Prefecture, where they would later in 2004 form the band Blue Encount. The band's name derives from a jinx that says bands with a color in their name sells, as well as a movie that the vocalist Shunichi saw at a rental shop titled "Blue Encounter".

In 2006, at the TEENS' MUSIC FESTIVAL, which was sponsored by the Yamaha Music Promotion Association and Nippon Broadcasting, they participated in the Kyuushuu qualifying round as the Kumamoto Prefecture representative, but they did not advance to the national competition. The bassist at the time withdrew from the band to enter university, and after graduating from a certain college of technology Yuuya and Yoshihide came to Tokyo and began studying at the Tokyo School of Music College in Shibuya. Yuuta, a senior at a vocational school participated as a support member at the time.

In 2008, the band participated in Yamaha's "The 2nd Music Revolution JAPAN FINAL" as a representative of Tokyo FINAL. This is also when Yuuta officially decided to join the band.

In 2010, the band released their first mini album titled "The Beginning of the Beginning". The response on the album were not as expected, and the members of the band instead called it "The Dark Ages". After that, they went on a split tour with the bands ircle and SUPER BEAVER, and said that occasional advice from both of the bands was a large help to escape the "dark age" as they called it.

On April 11, 2012, the 2nd mini album "HALO EFFECT" was released. The title song "HALO" has helped increase the number of YouTube views, and the number of live shows started piling in for them as a band.

On November, 2013, they released a split album titled "BONEDS" with the bands [MY FIRST STORY](https://anilist.co/staff/127675/My-First-Story), AIR SWELL and [SWANKY DANK](https://anilist.co/staff/132868/SWANKY-DANK).

On September 10, 2014, they made a major debut under Ki/oon Music with their EP titled "TIMELESS ROOKIE", this is also when they left their previous record label titled 美音 (Mio).

On October 9, 2016, the band made had their first one-man live show held at the Nippon Budokan. The tickets sold out the same day and had 11.000 people pending for the show. In addition, during this live performance, they directy spoke with the producer of the Japanese television drama "THE LaST COP/ラストコップ", and was then scheduled to perform the theme song for the show. The drama first broadcasted on the October 29, which is when they made their first appearance in a serial TV drama as a unit.

__Members:__
- [Shunichi Tanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/148599/Shunichi-Tanabe) (田邊駿一) - vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition (2004-)
- Yuuya Eguchi (江口雄也) - guitarist (2004-)
- Yuuta Tsujimura (辻村勇太) - bassist (2006-2008, as a support member) (2008-, as an official member)
- Yoshihide Takamura (高村佳秀) - drummer (2004-)

(Source: [Wikipedia (BLUE ENCOUNT)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/BLUE_ENCOUNT), edited)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_______0108) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKY2bA32pWSarPK54mSbHZw) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_.otoha._/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/742290037)

Co-founder of [Albacrow](https://anilist.co/studio/6316/).

After graduating from the Department of Fine Arts, Faculty of Art and Design, Onomichi City University he joined studio [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). 
Currently affiliated with [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858).

His animation bears heavy influence from [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) with the added aspect of *Sumi-e* brush painting techniques, resulting in very characteristic lineart. He first attracted attention with his work on [Fullmetal Alchemist: Brotherhood](https://anilist.co/anime/5114/).

Married to [Maiko Okada](https://anilist.co/staff/138501).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/742290037)
